info.title: SimpleLogin (unofficial)
info.description: The unofficial SimpleLogin API docs as OpenAPI 3.0.0 spec. This is based on the official markdown based docs, but written in OpenAPI to allow for easier integration with other tools and generation of client SDKs. Please do not contact the SimpleLogin team for support or issues with this API documentation.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Either `uuid` or `word`. By default, use the user setting when creating new random alias.

get.description: Get activities for specific alias by id.
Get contacts for specific alias by id.

post.description: Create a new contact for an alias by id.

requestBody.description: Updated settings for the given alias.
Updated settings for the given alias.

post.description: Enable or disable specific alias by id.
Generate a new API key associated with a specific device for authentication
Activate a new account with the activation code that was sent to the user's email.

410.description: Wrong code entered too often. User needs to ask for a new code using reactivate endpoint.

post.description: Request a link to reset the password for a registered account.

200.description: Always returns 200, no matter if the email is registered or not. User is going to receive an email that contains a link to reset their password.

post.description: Login using email and password to get an access token.

requestBody.description: The api_key is used in all subsequent requests. It's empty if MFA is enabled. If user hasn't enabled MFA, mfa_key is empty.

post.description: Request a new activation code for an account that was already registered, but not activated yet.

200.description: Successful. User is going to receive an email that contains an activation code.
Successful. User is going to receive an email that contains an activation code. User needs to enter this code to confirm their account with the activate endpoint.

post.description: Block or unblock a contact by id. Toggles the block_forward status.

patch.description: Update settings for a custom domain.

requestBody.description: Updated settings for the custom domain.

get.description: Get all deleted aliases for a custom domain (trash).
Export user aliases in an importable CSV format that can be used in the settings screen

200.description: Successful export of aliases as CSV file

get.description: Export comprehensive user data including aliases, custom domains, and app information
Check if the API server is healthy and responding. This endpoint does not require authentication.

servers.description: SimpleLogin root (health endpoint is at root level, not under /api)

201.description: New mailbox is created successfully. User is going to receive a verification email.

400.description: The error message can be displayed to user
The error message can be displayed to user
The error message can be displayed to user

get.description: Returns stats about the number of aliases, number of emails forwarded/replied/blocked
Get a one time use cookie to exchange it for a valid cookie in the web app

200.description: Successful. Account is scheduled for deletion.

get.description: Get user aliases. Please note `pinned`, `disabled`, `enabled` are exclusive, i.e. only one can be present. They can only be set to `true`.

parameters.name: pinned
parameters.description: If set, only pinned aliases are returned.

parameters.name: disabled
parameters.description: If set, only disabled aliases are returned.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: If set, only enabled aliases are returned.

post.description: Search user aliases. Please note `pinned`, `disabled`, `enabled` are exclusive, i.e. only one can be present. They can only be set to `true`.

parameters.name: pinned
parameters.description: If set, only pinned aliases are returned.

parameters.name: disabled
parameters.description: If set, only disabled aliases are returned.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: If set, only enabled aliases are returned.

get.summary: Get available domains for random aliases
get.description: Retrieve available domains for random alias creation
User alias info and suggestion. Used by the first extension screen when user opens the extension.

QueryHostname.name: hostname
QueryHostname.description: This information is important to know where an alias is used in order to suggest user the same alias if they want to create on alias on the same website in the future.

QueryPageId.name: page_id
QueryPageId.description: The endpoint returns maximum 20 aliases for each page.

alias_prefix.description: The first part of the alias that user can choose.

signed_suffix.description: One of the suffixes returned in the options endpoint.

AliasExport.description: Simplified alias model returned by the export endpoint

can_create.description: Whether the user can create an alias or not

query.description: Full-text search for the e-mail address of the alias

id.description: Unique identifier for the email address.

last_email_sent_timestamp.description: Unix timestamp when the last email was sent.

reverse_alias.description: Reverse alias for the email address.

block_forward.description: Whether the email address is blocked for forwarding.

api_key.description: The generated API key for authentication

device.description: The device's name, used to identify the API key for management purposes

name.description: User's name, could be an empty string.

mfa_key.description: Only useful when user enables MFA. In this case, user needs to enter their OTP token in order to login.

api_key.description: If MFA is not enabled, the api key is returned right away.

name.description: User's name, could be an empty string

api_key.description: If MFA is not enabled, the api key is returned right away.

mfa_key.description: MFA key obtained in previous auth request

device.description: The device name, used to create an ApiKey associated with this device

deleted.description: Whether the contact was successfully deleted.

block_forward.description: Whether forwarding from this contact is blocked. When true, forwarding is blocked; when false, forwarding is allowed.

catch_all.description: Enable or disable catch-all for this domain

random_prefix_generation.description: Enable or disable random prefix generation for this domain

name.description: Display name for the custom domain

mailbox_ids.description: Array of mailbox IDs to associate with this domain

aliases.description: List of deleted aliases for this custom domain
List of all user aliases (simplified format for export)

custom_domains.description: List of all user custom domains

is_premium.description: Whether the user is a premium user

in_trial.description: Whether the user is in trial period

profile_picture.description: URL of the user's profile picture

max_alias_free_plan.description: Maximum number of aliases for free plan users

default.description: If true, set the mailbox as the default mailbox.

cancel_email_change.description: If true, cancel the email change of the mailbox.

domain.description: The domain name available for random alias creation

is_custom.description: Whether the domain belongs to the user (true) or the platform (false)

random_alias_suffix.description: Suffix generation method for random aliases
Suffix generation method for random aliases

is_premium.description: Whether the user is a premium user or not

in_trial.description: Whether the user is in trial period or not

profile_picture.description: URL of the user's profile picture
Image of the new profile picture encoded in base64. Set to null to remove current profile picture.
